title: Let's pause for a hot second.
subtitle: Before you start reflecting, take a minute to breathe slowly and deeply from your diaphragm, or do something else that helps you feel relaxed.

title: Manifesto: My personal intention for how I want to show up as an ally.
examples: I want to show up in a supportive way that helps others feel heard
I want to actively dismantle the ways I have been complicit in an oppressive system
I want to help sway and onboard new allies
I want to contribute to direct action
I want to help dismantle structural racism in my field, workplace, or community

title: 3+ ways I will commit to this in my daily life, starting now
examples: I will offer support without expecting recognition
I will seek out and amplify Black perspectives
I will do my best to listen and affirm, with an open mind, without interrupting
I will find calls to action made by Black community leaders
I will initiate productive conversations about race issues with my relatives

title: 3+ resources that seem helpful for me to go through

examples.linkText: For Our White Friends Desiring To Be Allies | Sojo
examples.description: On better holding space for BIPOCs
Resources for PoC allies to facilitate empathetic conversations about BLM with non-allied relatives

examples.linkText: So You Want To Talk About Race (Ijeoma Oluo)
examples.description: Actionable tips on understanding subtle everyday racism and having productive conversations about race.

examples.linkText: The subtle linguistics of polite white supremacy | YawoBrown
examples.description: A quick primer on how covert, structural white supremacy has been hidden behind 'colorblind' language.

examples.linkText: Suggestions for allies to avoid burnout & think about long-term commitment | @TatianaTMac
The New Jim Crow: Mass Incarceration In An Age Of Colorblindness (Michelle Alexander)
examples.description: A history on discriminatory mass incarceration (Blacks being disproportionately targeted for misdemeanors that whites commit at the same or higher rate) as an avenue for covert modern slavery.

title: Skills or self-education I will need to acquire in order to better fulfill my intentions
subtitle: There's no shame in not having a skill right at this moment. We all start from wherever we are right now.
examples: I will learn about ways everyday/structural racism shows up in my profession
I will learn what microaggressions look like
I will learn how to mindfully sit with my discomfort so I can be present for others
I will learn more about modern Black history as told by Black authors/speakers
I will learn how to address common sticky points with non-allies in a level-headed and informed way

title: 3+ actions I feel capable of taking in the next 3 days
examples: Find a protest, or a way to provide support/aid to protesters
Call/text local legislators
Donate, or budget a donation capacity
Ask someone who is having a difficult time if you can do anything for them
Have an honest conversation about BLM with a non-ally (perhaps a relative)

title: What personal self-interest drives me most as an ally?
subtitle: (Independent of “why is this movement important”; if we're here, we already know that.)
examples: Personal trauma/PoC experience? Empathy with feelings of disempowerment & danger?
Wanting people you care about personally to be safe? BIPOCs who are close to you?
Are you more comfortable in diverse, thriving communities?
Wanting to contribute to something that matters?
Wanting to feel good and helpful?

title: When I feel discomfort about unpacking my own privilege, what can I remember?
examples: I need to stay present for the people I'm allied to.
It is okay and normal to feel discomfort.
I did not choose this privilege. I am choosing to dismantle it.
It is important for me to fully understand my privilege so I can actively reduce the ways that systemic privilege harms others.

title: How can I keep my momentum sustainable?
examples: Identify helpful things I can do that best utilize my strengths and skills.
Recognize when I am exhausted or triggered, and know what to do about it
Gather other people to collaborate with
Increase my personal friendship connections within this movement

title: How will these skills and intentions I am committing to prove valuable in my personal life?
